ygData.messageBody:
On Wed, 14 Jul 1999, Omega8 wrote:
>
> WHile I agree that bards, and all spellcasting guilds really, should have
> the ability ot bind themselves at SOME point... I find it shocking that you
> have had trouble with this service. In my experience, if you use the /who
> to find someone who is able to perform the service and the /tell them a
> polite IC request for aid (I usually ask if I might have a moment of thier
> time and then describe myself as newly arrived and in need of thier aid to
> reattune my soul to the area) most are more than willing to help. I have, I

I usually auction or shout an IC request. I pretty much have
money to burn (have started buying steel plate since I have
nothing else to spend it on), so I pay roughly 1gp per level
(e.g. 2.5pp at L26). The vast majority of binders have
refused payment.

If I don't get any responses, I keep trying and usually give
like 5pp to the person who eventually does bind me. I want
him to start thinking, "Boy am I glad I answered that bind
request. I should do so more often."

--
John H. Kim
